intro: Amphiglottis secunda, commonly known as the narrow-leafed amphiglottis, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
